video_description:
**WORLD PREMIERE**

Watch Hyundai Canada's official 2013 Big Game Day Commercial, titled "GASPOCALYPSE" here!
Starring the Sonata Hybrid, four 'weekend warriors', and a very generous Hyundai driver.


Sonata Hybrid Showroom: http://goo.gl/SLubK



Due to popular demand, we've made the song in this commercial available for download! Click on the link, then click on the download button (arrow pointing down). Enjoy!

https://soundcloud.com/hyundaicanada/gaspocalypse_commercial_psychosis

Song title: Psychosis
Original composition created by RMW Music Canada
© rmwmusic 2013
------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Connect with us!
http://facebook.com/hyundaicanada
http://hyundaicanada.com
title: Hyundai Canada's 2013 Big Game Day Commercial "GASPOCALYPSE"  (Official)

comments.text: Its actually a Sebring, not a Civic. I think the ad's targetting folks that own 4wd's and muscle cars, some call those vehicle's their "Weekend warrior" Heck Ive got one, but I dont see how a Hyundai would make a good replacement. A weekend warrior vehicle is something you can go out for a little bit and have a little fun at the sake of some extra gas burning. Then we﻿ go back to our normal, boring, fuel efficient cars come Monday.

comments.text: I am part of﻿ the planning committee for the Future Of Transportation Symposium here in Edmonton Alberta. This is it's 3rd year initiated by the Alberta Solar Energy Society and are taking it to a new grand level with assistance of NAIT. We are expecting well over 30 different green vehicles as part of the symposium. Hyundai hasn't really come up in our meetings. After seeing this I think this needs to change. Could you tell me who I could contact to about getting Hyundai Canada involved??

comments.text: Thanks!﻿ I must commend you for the musical style choice.. Although its portrayed as a gas guzzeling monster.. its awesome!

comments.text:
You wanna save the world? maintain a olde used car. The energy it takes to make this new car plus all the hybrid crap which is toxic, is way more harmful to the environment then my old ass 18 yr old﻿ car with top notch maintenance, flawless emissions tests etc for the next ohhh 60 years+

Oh, lets not forget the energy it takes to recycle materials from spent vehicles.

This hybrid crap makes me laugh, what an illusion for the blind. Maintenance is more enviro friendly then replacement.

comments.text: These are all normative statements.  90% of the battery﻿ can be recycled into a new ones. Hopefully you will still be able to buy gas in 60 years if there is any left.
comments.author: Andrew Bell

comments.text: When outdated ICE cars are crushed at the end of their life to﻿ make hybrids the energy used to to make new steel uses 75%﻿ less energy than using raw steel. You also need to take into account the the increasing external costs such as health costs and military costs to keep the gas and oil for your old inefficient car going.
comments.author: Andrew Bell

comments.text: Well no. Its not like the majority of mid 80s cars were that much less efficient,﻿ especially small 4 cylinder cars. Don't forget the energy it takes to recycle materials, and to MAKE new metal, MAKE plastics, MAKE other parts, the assembly line , and the ships to transport the cars. For Hybrids, the ships that ship nickel from canada to china, then to japan, then back to where the car is made. Thats a lot of pollution, Oh, my 1995 318is still gets 32mpg in the city, and a whopping 44mpg hwy
comments.author: mi16t

comments.text: Its a old car. There are plenty of "efficient" new cars with similar engine sizes that can't touch﻿ that 32/44mpg...
comments.author: mi16t

comments.text:
People seem to forget that cars need MAINTENANCE to continue to be efficient and well running. Sensors, Sparks, air hoses, vac hoses, O2s, etc etc. Those parts are peanuts, even if bought at upsurd dealer prices compared to the price of a brand new vehicle. 

You don't﻿ just buy a car and drive it without doing anything.
